bibl.title: Letter to William Crawford Gorgas, May 22, 1917

div1.p: The writer is interested in continuing yellow fever work, but cannot be of assistance at the moment.

div1.head: Letter to William Crawford Gorgas, May 22, 1917
div1.p:
I have your letter of the 18th., just received, and in
reply would say that I would like well to continue the work on
the Yellow Fever problem. Whether I am available or not, depends
on when the expedition would start.

It would be wrong for me to leave my leave my present
detail at present; I doubt if I can do so until fall, but certainly
not now. I was available in February or March before this detail
came up. When would you want us to go?
